unnormalised: Someone asked me about the worst delivery experience I've had in India. Well, let me tell you, it was a doozy involving a package, a courier guy, and a very confused address. I was expecting a textbook for my niece, Riya, living at 12/B, Shankar Nagar, Nagpur, 440010. The tracking info said "Out for Delivery" at 10:30 AM, and I was stoked. I even preponed my meeting to ensure someone was home.
normalised: Someone asked me about the worst delivery experience I have had in India. Well, let me tell you, it was a doozy involving a package, a courier guy, and a very confused address. I was expecting a textbook for my niece, Riya, living at twelve B, Shankar Nagar, Nagpur, four hundred and forty thousand and ten. The tracking info said "Out for Delivery" at ten thirty A-M, and I was stoked. I even preponed my meeting to ensure someone was home.

unnormalised: But then, nothing. I called the courier service customer care multiple times. Finally, around 6 PM, a rather harried delivery guy called. He kept saying he couldn't find "Shankar Nagar." Apparently, his system only showed "Shankar", no "Nagar", and he'd been going around asking if "Shankar uncle" lived anywhere! After a lengthy explanation and giving him the exact GPS coordinates from Google Maps (and landmarks like "Near Haldiram's" and "opposite the Hanuman temple"), he finally, FINALLY found the place.

unnormalised: The package arrived at 8 PM, soaking wet, and the book inside was damaged. The delivery guy sheepishly apologized, mumbled something about "server issues," and sped off. It was a comedy of errors, all because the address was slightly off in their system. Lesson learned: always double-check the address format *they* use, not just the standard one. And maybe offer chai to the poor delivery fellow - he looked like he'd aged 10 years!
